option.DisplayText: {{nothinpersonnel|Blink Mutation}}: Verbosity of debug entries output to Player.log
option.helptext:
{{g|0}}: Only infrequnet entries will be sent to Player.log, and only for reporting on normal function. {{W|1}}: Debug entries will be sent to Player.log when certain functions are perfomed within this mod. {{o|2}}: More frequent Player.log entries for a wider array of functions, often tracing broad program flow. {{r|3}}: Even more Player.log entries including current internal values as they're passed around. {{R|4}}: {{R|Not Recommended}} | Maximum number of entries to Player.log including tracing common or frequent loops.
The value default is {{g|0}}.

option.DisplayText: {{nothinpersonnel|Blink Mutation}}: Also show debug entries in the Message Queue
option.helptext:
When enabled, debug entries will be sent to the Message Queue any time (with few exceptions) they would be sent to Player.log. At higher levels of verbosity, this can be {{r|very}} "loud" and spammy.
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.

option.DisplayText: {{nothinpersonnel|Blink Mutation}}: Show {{m|Blink}} internal debug information in relevant ShortDescriptions displayed in the [{{W|l}}]ook UI.
option.helptext:
When enabled, internal debug information relating to the {{m|Blink}} mutation will be displayed when [{{W|l}}]ooking at anything with the relevant part.
{{M|Blink}}: {{W|General}}: Mutation Level information. {{W|Mechanics}}: Information specific to the function of Blinking. {{W|State}}: Current internal flags used to determine different actions happening.
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.

option.DisplayText: {{nothinpersonnel|Blink Mutation}}: Show {{C|Overclocked Central Nervous System}} internal debug information in relevant ShortDescriptions displayed in the [{{W|l}}]ook UI.
option.helptext:

{{M|Overclocked Central Nervous System}}: {{W|General}}: Mutation Level information. {{W|Mechanics}}: Information specific to the function of Blinking/Flicker Striking. {{W|State}}: Current internal flags used to determine different actions happening.
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.

option.DisplayText: {{nothinpersonnel|Blink Mutation}}: Show {{m|AI_UD_Blinker}} internal debug information in relevant ShortDescriptions displayed in the [{{W|l}}]ook UI.

option.DisplayText: {{nothinpersonnel|Blink Mutation}}: Ignore the player when {{R|AI_UD_Sq{{Y|u}}are{{Y|U}}p}} is squaring up for a worthy opponent.
option.helptext:
When enabled, creatures with the {{R|AI_UD_Sq{{Y|u}}are{{Y|U}}p}} behaviour will ignore the player as a viable opponent to make it easier to observe how they'd react in the player's absence.
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.

option.DisplayText: Enable obnoxious shouts from most types of creatures who have the Blink mutation included in this mod.
option.helptext:
When enabled, blinking through or into hostile creatures results in the blinking creature emitting a "shout" based on the result of their blink.
At higher levels, the short cooldown and the cooldown being refreshed when dealing damage results in a fair amount of on-screen visual clutter during fights.
It's worth trying for a bit and turning off if you find it too obnoxious.
The default is {{w|Enabled}}.

option.DisplayText: Enable refreshing the cooldown on Blink when successfully dealing damage with Cold Steel.
option.helptext:
When enabled, blink won't go on cooldown if the blinker successfully deals damage with their Cold Steel.
This allows for some, frankly, quite cool fights but makes creatures with blink a bit more dangerous since they can repeatedly blink back and forth through their targets and deal guaranteed damage every time.
The energy cost (action cost) of dealing damage with Cold Steel is 1.25x that of a standard action to increase the risk of using blink this way.
The default is {{w|Enabled}}.

option.DisplayText: Enable cybernetic flicker strike falling back to random targets if target is killed mid-flicker strike.
option.helptext:
When enabled, flicker strike (as granted by the overclocked central nervous system) will use any remaining flicker charges to strike random nearby hostile creatures.
While you get greater precision leaving this disabled, it's at a very slight average energy cost increase performing flicker strike any time the manoeuvre completes without fully depleting your flicker charges.
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.
